meanings.definition: A game in which players on two teams try to throw balls and hit opponents while avoiding being hit themselves.
meanings.sent1: During recess, we played dodgeball in the schoolyard.
meanings.sent2: The children had a blast playing dodgeball at the birthday party.
meanings.sent3: The dodgeball game got intense when everyone started dodging the balls.
meanings.sent4: Life can sometimes feel like a game of dodgeball, trying to avoid obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The sound of dodgeballs hitting the walls echoed through the gymnasium.

meanings.definition: To move quickly to one side in order to avoid being hit by something.
meanings.sent1: She had to dodgeball to the left to avoid the flying object.
meanings.sent2: The cat tried to dodgeball the water spray from the hose.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel had to dodgeball around the tree to escape the chasing dog.
meanings.sent4: He had to dodgeball through the crowd to catch the bus on time.
meanings.sent5: The ninja had to dodgeball the enemy's attacks with swift movements.
